description.en: Topics covered by the course include: major themes in HCI from both a theoretical and practical perspective; key concepts of cognitive and social approaches to HCI; a survey of HCI methodologies and techniques for HCI design and evaluation.
description.et: Kursusel käsitletavad teemad on järgmised: HCI peamised teemad nii teoreetilisest kui ka praktilisest vaatenurgast; HCI kognitiivse ja sotsiaalse lähenemisviisi põhikontseptsioonid; uuringud HCI metoodikate ja tehnikate kohta HCI kavandamiseks ja hindamiseks.

objectives.en: This course will provide a theoretical and practical understanding of human-computer interaction (HCI) design including concepts of user-centered and design thinking, usability, interfaces, rapid prototyping, and evaluation.
objectives.et: See kursus annab teoreetilise ja praktilise arusaama inimese ja arvuti interaktsiooni (HCI) disainist, sealhulgas kasutajakeskse ja disainimõtlemise, kasutatavuse, liideste, kiire prototüüpide loomise ja hindamise kontseptsioonidest.

learning_outcomes.en: On successful completion of this course, students will able to:
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse eduka läbimise järel on tudengid võimelised:

learning_outcomes.en: Understand the relationship between people and digital technologies
learning_outcomes.et: Mõista inimeste ja digitehnoloogiate vahelist suhet.

learning_outcomes.en: Gain knowledge of the User-Centered Design process and techniques for rapid prototyping
learning_outcomes.et: Saada teadmisi kasutajakeskse disaini protsessist ja kiire prototüüpimise tehnikatest

learning_outcomes.en: Become familiar with approaches for gathering and analysing user data, and conveying design concepts
learning_outcomes.et: Tutvuda lähenemisviisidega kasutajaandmete kogumiseks ja analüüsimiseks ning kujunduskontseptsioonide edastamiseks

learning_outcomes.en: Cover the fundamental principles of HCI
Identify and deploy a selection of HCI design methodologies
learning_outcomes.et: Teha kindlaks ja rakendada HCI projekteerimismetoodikate valikuid

learning_outcomes.en: Become familiar with approaches for the evaluation of computing systems

grade_evaluation.en:
The resulting score (out of 100) will be mapped to the following grades:
*	A: 100 - 91
*	B: 90 - 81
*	C: 80 - 71
*	D: 70 - 61
*	E: 60 - 51
*	F: 50 - 0
A grade higher than F (more than 50 points) and the submission of all reports and the final prototype are required to pass the course. For assignments that are handed in after the presented deadline 50% of the points will be deducted per day.
All your submissions will be checked by Urkund for plagiarism. Please make sure your submissions are original work and with citation and referencing done according to the rules and regulations of the University of Tartu. You can read more about this topic here: https://www.ut.ee/en/current-students/academic-fraud
